name.en: Internet of Things and Big Data Analysis

goal.ch:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to: 
•Gain insight into the interdisciplinary field of data science.
•Analyze data using machine learning techniques.
•Conduct scientific literature review on related techniques.
•Understand the components of Internet of Things
•Understand the impact of IoT on society
•Understand the components of an embedded system
•Understand the architecture of an IoT system in terms of software and hardware
•Implement basic programs for an IoT device
•Implement a simple IoT system with cloud-based services
goal.en:
Upon completion of this course, students will be able to: 
•Gain insight into the interdisciplinary field of data science.
•Analyze data using machine learning techniques.
•Conduct scientific literature review on related techniques.
•Understand the components of Internet of Things
•Understand the impact of IoT on society
•Understand the components of an embedded system
•Understand the architecture of an IoT system in terms of software and hardware
•Implement basic programs for an IoT device
•Implement a simple IoT system with cloud-based services

outline.ch: As more and more devices in homes, cars, factories, hospitals and many other premises are connected to the Internet, it is becoming increasingly necessary to provide solutions to link them together, gather and analyze data from them. This course aims to introduce how data analytics and IoT work together to provide intelligent solutions. Students will familiarize themselves with the concepts of “Internet of Things“ and their basic applications, and learn how hardware and software interface with each other, how IoT components are connected and how to implement an IoT application along with data analytic capability.
outline.en: As more and more devices in homes, cars, factories, hospitals and many other premises are connected to the Internet, it is becoming increasingly necessary to provide solutions to link them together, gather and analyze data from them. This course aims to introduce how data analytics and IoT work together to provide intelligent solutions. Students will familiarize themselves with the concepts of “Internet of Things“ and their basic applications, and learn how hardware and software interface with each other, how IoT components are connected and how to implement an IoT application along with data analytic capability.

textbook.ch:
•C. D. Manning, P. Raghavan and H. Schütze, Introduction to Information Retrieval, Cambridge University Press. 2008.
•L. Igual, S. Seguí, Introduction to Data Science: A Python Approach to Concepts, Techniques and Applications, Springer, 2017
•J. Grus, Data Science from Scratch: First Principles with Python, O’Reilly, 2015
•Advanced Raspberry Pi: Raspbian Linux and GPIO Integration / by Warren Gay. ISBN: 9781484239483
•Learn Raspberry Pi programming with Python: learn to program on the world‘s most popular tiny computer / by Wolfram Donat. ISBN: 9781484237694
•Beginning artificial intelligence with the Raspberry Pi / by Donald J. Norris. ISBN: 9781484227435
*** Note: There is no textbook for this course. You are encouraged to refer to as many materials as possible.
textbook.en:
•C. D. Manning, P. Raghavan and H. Schütze, Introduction to Information Retrieval, Cambridge University Press. 2008.
•L. Igual, S. Seguí, Introduction to Data Science: A Python Approach to Concepts, Techniques and Applications, Springer, 2017
•J. Grus, Data Science from Scratch: First Principles with Python, O’Reilly, 2015
•Advanced Raspberry Pi: Raspbian Linux and GPIO Integration / by Warren Gay. ISBN: 9781484239483
•Learn Raspberry Pi programming with Python: learn to program on the world‘s most popular tiny computer / by Wolfram Donat. ISBN: 9781484237694
•Beginning artificial intelligence with the Raspberry Pi / by Donald J. Norris. ISBN: 9781484227435
*** Note: There is no textbook for this course. You are encouraged to refer to as many materials as possible.
